articles.author: Maria Martinez, Holger Hansen
articles.description: Germany plans to halve its military aid to Ukraine next year, despite concerns that U.S. support for Kyiv could potentially diminish if Republican candidate Donald Trump returns to the White House.
articles.title: Germany to halve military aid for Ukraine despite possible Trump White House

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Four decades ago, the United States deployed cruise and Pershing II nuclear missiles in Europe to counter Soviet SS-20s - a move that stoked Cold War tensions but led within years to a historic disarmament deal.
articles.title: How dangerous is the new US-Russia missile race?

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded areas in the central Gaza Strip on Wednesday, killing at least nine Palestinians, according to health officials, while Israeli tanks carried out a limited advance further into Rafah in the south.
articles.title: Israel pounds central Gaza, sends tanks into north of Rafah

articles.author: Aziz Taher, Ahmad El Kerdi
articles.description: Hezbollah will hit new Israeli targets if Israel keeps targeting civilians in Lebanon, the group's leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah said on Wednesday, saying there had been a spike in the number of non-combatants killed in Lebanon in recent days.
articles.title: Hezbollah to hit new areas in Israel if civilians targeted, Nasrallah says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged 95 prisoners of war each on Wednesday in the latest such swap after the United Arab Emirates acted as an intermediary, Russia's Defence ministry and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine conduct third prisoner exchange in recent months

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Police in Bangladesh fired tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse students protesting against the government's job quota system on Wednesday, a day after violent clashes left six people dead and scores injured.
articles.title: Bangladesh shuts universities, colleges indefinitely but protests mount

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The security chief of Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado was arrested early on Wednesday, her Vente Venezuela political movement said on X, raising questions over whether the July presidential election will be fair and free.
articles.title: Machado's security chief arrested days before Venezuela election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain will suffer its first heatwave of the summer starting on Thursday, the meteorology service AEMET said, as the government kicked off on Wednesday a heat risk awareness campaign for people working mostly outside.
articles.title: Spain warns workers of heat risks as summer's first heatwave looms

articles.author: Bart Meijer, Charlotte Van Campenhout
articles.description: The Netherlands commemorated the 298 victims of flight MH17 that was shot down over Ukraine 10 years ago with a ceremony attended by the bereaved and representatives from Malaysia, Australia, the UK, Belgium and Ukraine.
articles.title: Netherlands commemorates 10th anniversary of MH17 airline disaster

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia is ready to work with any U.S. leader - elected by the U.S. people – who is willing to engage in "equitable, mutually respectful dialogue," Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia ready to work with any US leader, says Lavrov
